suggested_topics: why some bridges last 2000 years and others collapse in 20
how coral reefs build their own weather systems
the logistics of running a 24-hour diner
why birds migrate in V formations — physics not instinct
the hidden math behind musical scales

formats.name: micro_manifesto
formats.instruction: Write a tiny manifesto in exactly three sentences, outlining your vision for how things SHOULD be in a given area. Be aspirational yet punchy.

formats.name: day_in_reverse
formats.instruction: Describe your day backwards, starting with how it ended and tracing back step by step to how it began. Highlight at least one absurd or unexpected moment.

formats.name: counter_fable
formats.instruction: Invent a brief fictional story that flips a famous moral (e.g. 'slow and steady loses the race'). End with a new lesson.

formats.name: emoji_review
formats.instruction: Summarize your feelings on an object, event, or idea using only emojis and two cryptic sentences.

formats.name: found_object_diary
formats.instruction: Pick a random object from your environment. Write a detailed account of its imagined journey from creation to present, including at least two speculative twists. 2-4 paragraphs.

formats.name: ambiguous_confession
formats.instruction: Reveal a personal confession but cloak it in metaphor, so readers must puzzle out your meaning. Use at least one vivid image.

formats.name: future_flashback
formats.instruction: Write as if you're remembering today from ten years in the future. What stands out, and what feels strange in hindsight?

formats.name: rapid_fire_questions
formats.instruction: Pose five rapid-fire questions (no answers!) about a single theme, each designed to spark debate or introspection.

formats.name: overheard_dialogue
formats.instruction: Describe a snippet of dialogue you overheard (real or imagined) and annotate it with your instant reactions. Write in two distinct sections.

formats.name: multiverse_solution
formats.instruction: Propose a wild solution to a real-world problem, then describe how it would play out in three alternate universes. 400-500 words with clear section breaks.

title_styles: Write a mysterious, poetic title that only makes sense after reading the post.
Write a clickbait-style challenge or dare. Examples: 'I bet you can't answer this', 'Try this if you dare!'
Write a classic news headline as if your post were breaking news.
Write a title using only emojis, then add a one-word subtitle.
Write a title in the form of a hypothetical question. Examples: 'What if Mondays were optional?', 'If cats could text...'
structure_variants: Write as a list of contrasting pairs: idea vs reality, myth vs truth, expectation vs outcome.
Structure as alternating bold claims and immediate self-reflections.
Present first as an unsolvable puzzle, then reveal your solution step by step.
Begin with an imaginary letter to yourself, then respond in a different voice.
Break up your content with three unrelated illustrations or analogies.
topic_angles: How technology warps our sense of time and ‘now’
The secret lives of ordinary objects
Rituals people invent to stay sane in chaos
